snippet: The North End, which has both glorious homes and some of the city’s harshest blight, captures both the hope and challenge of the mayor’s pledge to improve Detroit.
abstract: Detroit's North End, which has both glorious homes and some of the city’s harshest blight, captures both the hope and challenge of Mayor Mike Duggan's pledge to improve the bankrupt city; tracking what happens in the neighborhood, area undergoing change, in 2014 and 2015 will tell a lot about whether Detroit, with nearly 690,000 residents, can rebuild (Series: Ruin and Renewal).

byline.contributor: Monica Davey contributed reporting and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The North End, which has both glorious homes and some of the city’s harshest blight, captures both the hope and challenge of the mayor’s pledge to improve Detroit.

headline.seo: Mayor Mike Duggan’s Pledges Echo in Detroit’s North End
headline.main: Testing Ground for a New Detroit
headline.print_headline: Testing Ground for a New Detroit
